Posts.Content: Thank you all again!! We will be going to MDA next Friday. So exactly two weeks post surgery. I guess my concern was that if we went there would we have to get his treatments there? We have a life and family here. Children in school. So if he would not be able to work we couldn't afford for him to stay there away from us. Does that make sense? Either way I do agree with you all. We are fortunate to be able to go to NDA and we are doing everything we can to make it happen. After all this is the rest of his life we are talking about. He deserves the best!!
Posts.Title: Gleason 10 / robotic prostectomy 6 days ago

Posts.Title: Gleason 10 / robotic prostectomy 6 days ago

Posts.Content: Hello, this is my first time visiting this board. Thank you all for the information you provide to help others. Nov 22 we got the call that my husband has prostate cancer. He was out of state for 3 weeks. The doctor said no reason for him to come home. Three weeks wouldn't matter. He arrives home 3 weeks later and we get the news that he has prostate cancer and it is a rare form. He has signet cell and his Gleason is 5+5 a big 10! We spoke of options and he said with the type and aggressiveness of this cancer the best move was surgery asap. He is a very good surgeon and we were comfortable with what he said but wanted a second opinion. Called MDA to get a second opinion but then the doctor scheduled surgery before we could get an appt at MDA. Hubby had surgery, a week ago. Doctor called today saying prostate was definitely a 10. Lymph. Odds were normal but the cancer leaked out of the top and they couldn't cut it away? Those were hubbys words. I'm guessing there is a margin? The dr is recommending radiology when he is healed from surgery. My questions are: should we explore other options? Should we contact MDA ? The surgeons job is done should we now seek an oncologist ? My husband works out of state 3 weeks gone then 3 weeks home, will these treatments keep him at home since he can't fly back and forth daily? My head is spinning and we are only 2 months into this long journey.. we appreciate any help that is given.
Posts.Title: Gleason 10 / robotic prostectomy 6 days ago

Posts.Content: Wow, thank you all so very much for your reply. I will be calling MDA today. We are a few hours from there but we are willing to drive. This is the beginning of our journey so we have a lot to learn . It is so nice being able to come on here and have someplace to ask questions. It's even nicer to have others that are willing to take time out of their lives to read and answer your questions. I will come back when I have time to put together a signature. Thank you again!!

Posts.Title: Gleason 10 / robotic prostectomy 6 days ago

Posts.Content: Thank you all. We did end up calling and he assured us that it was okay. It seems right after we called the bruising started getting a yellowish color, meaning it is starting to fade. Thank you all for your responses..
Posts.Title: Bruising on abdomen after robotic surgery?

Posts.Content: I am so very glad I found this forum!!! My first post was yesterday and I had great feedback and feel so fortunate to be able to come here to read and ask questions. Thank you to all that continue to help others through this journey. My husband had his surgery a week ago today. He continues to bruise on both sides of his abdomen. It's creeping it's way to the front and it's a very dark purple. Seems every morning it's bigger and darker. He's still very much bloated. It's about from his ribs down to his belly button and looks aweful! I haven't read where others have mentioned this. He wants to wait to call the doctor until Monday and we couldn't call today because they are closed on Fridays. Anyone experience this or know if it might be normal? Thanks in advance!!
Posts.Title: Bruising on abdomen after robotic surgery?
